main event: Three pilots observed a flying disc at Moses Lake Air Force Base, Washington on May 23, 1949.
interesting points: The object was observed at approximately 0545 hours local time., The weather was clear during the sighting., The object was silver in color and appeared very small from the point of observation., The object traveled at a very high rate of speed and was estimated to be 8-10 miles from the base., The sighting lasted for 1 to 1 and 1/2 minutes before the object disappeared from sight.
witness description: Lt Col Walter C. Searle, Lt Col Wallace Jordan, and 1st Lt Gerald J Bliss, all pilots
